abstract: The president of the European Central Bank said the calamity in Japan had not altered the need to fight European inflation with higher interest rates.
snippet: The president of the European Central Bank said the calamity in Japan had not altered the need to fight European inflation with higher interest rates.
lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — Jean-Claude Trichet, the president of the European Central Bank, stood by his prediction of higher interest rates for the euro zone on Monday despite the recent calamity in Japan.

headline.main: Trichet Persists in Expecting to Raise Europe’s Benchmark Rate
headline.print_headline: Trichet Persists in Expecting to Raise Europe’s Benchmark Rate
